thread.title: Something old new again at Dayton airportTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Something old new again at Dayton airportTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Something old new again at Dayton airportTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Something old new again at Dayton airport Published on : Saturday, August 29, 2015
The Dayton International Airport is offering something old that is new again.
It installed public telephones for passengers to use for free.
Nine phones are now located throughout the airport.
“Nearly everyone carries a cell phone today, of course,” said Director of Aviation Terry Slaybaugh. “But every now and then a cell battery dies, or a phone may be needed for any number of reasons. Dayton International Airport is happy to provide this convenience.”
Long distance charges must be paid for with a calling card. Emergency phone calls will be directed to airport police.
Source:- Dayton airport
